chart_metadata.description: A network load-balancer implementation for Kubernetes using standard routing protocols
chart_metadata.name: metallb-config

groups.name: Container Image
groups.description: Image to be used for container

groups.name: Networking and Services
groups.description: Configure Network and Services for Container

groups.name: Storage and Persistence
groups.description: Persist and Share Data that is Separate from the Container

groups.name: Resources and Devices
groups.description: Specify Resources/Devices to be Allocated to Workload

attrs.label: Stop All
attrs.description: Stops All Running pods and hibernates cnpg

attrs.label: Name
attrs.description: Name of the IP address pool

attrs.label: Auto Assign
attrs.description: AutoAssign flag used to prevent MetallB from automatic allocation for a pool.

attrs.label: Avoid Buggy IPs
attrs.description: AvoidBuggyIPs prevents addresses ending with .0 and .255 to be used by a pool.

attrs.label: Addresses Pools
attrs.description: A list of IP address ranges over which MetalLB has authority. You can list multiple ranges in a single pool, they will all share the same settings. Each range can be either a CIDR prefix, or an explicit start-end range of IPs.

questions.label: L2 Advertisements
questions.description: L2Advertisement allows to advertise the LoadBalancer IPs provided by the selected pools via L2.

attrs.label: Name
attrs.description: Name of the L2 Advertisement

attrs.label: Address Pools
attrs.description: The list of IPAddressPools to advertise via this advertisement, selected by name.

attrs.label: Node Selectors
attrs.description: NodeSelectors allows to limit the nodes to announce as next hops for the LoadBalancer IP. When empty, all the nodes having  are announced as next hops.

questions.label: Communities
questions.description: Community is a collection of aliases for communities. Users can define named aliases to be used in the BGPPeer CRD.

attrs.label: Name
attrs.description: The name of the alias for the community.

attrs.label: Value
attrs.description: The BGP community value corresponding to the given name.

questions.label: Peers
questions.description: BGPPeer is the Schema for the peers API.

attrs.label: Name
attrs.description: The name of the peer.

attrs.label: BFD Profile
attrs.description: The name of the BFD Profile to be used for the BFD session associated to the BGP session. If not set, the BFD session won't be set up.

attrs.label: EBGP MultiHop
attrs.description: TTo set if the BGPPeer is multi-hops away. Needed for FRR mode only.

attrs.label: Hold Time
attrs.description: Requested BGP hold time, per RFC4271.

attrs.label: Keep Alive Time
attrs.description: Requested BGP keep alive time, per RFC4271.

attrs.label: My ASN
attrs.description: AS number to use for the local end of the session.

attrs.label: Password
attrs.description: Authentication password for routers enforcing TCP MD5 authenticated sessions

attrs.label: Peer ASN
attrs.description: AS number to expect from the remote end of the session.

attrs.label: Peer Address
attrs.description: Address to dial when establishing the session.

attrs.label: Peer Port
attrs.description: Port to dial when establishing the session.

attrs.label: Router ID
attrs.description: BGP router ID to advertise to the peer

attrs.label: Source Address
attrs.description: Source address to use when establishing the session.

attrs.label: Node Selectors
attrs.description: Only connect to this peer on nodes that match one of these selectors.

questions.label: BGP Advertisements
questions.description: BGPAdvertisement allows to advertise the IPs coming from the selected IPAddressPools via BGP.

attrs.label: Name
attrs.description: Name of the BGP Advertisement

attrs.label: Address Pools
attrs.description: The list of IPAddressPools to advertise via this advertisement, selected by name.

attrs.label: Aggregation Length
attrs.description: The aggregation-length advertisement option lets you "roll up" the /32s into a larger prefix. Defaults to 32. Works for IPv4 addresses.

attrs.label: Local Pref
attrs.description: The BGP LOCAL_PREF attribute which is used by BGP best path algorithm, Path with higher localpref is preferred over one with lower localpref.

attrs.label: Communities
attrs.description: The BGP communities to be associated with the announcement. Each item can be a community of the form 1234:1234 or the name of an alias defined in the Community CRD.

attrs.label: Peers
attrs.description: Peers limits the BGPpeer to advertise the ips of the selected pools to. When empty, the loadbalancer IP is announced to all the BGPPeers configured.

6.5.2.app_readme:
A network load-balancer implementation for Kubernetes using standard routing protocols

This App is supplied by TrueCharts, for more information visit the manual: https://truecharts.org/charts/enterprise/metallb-config

TrueCharts can only exist due to the incredible effort of our staff. Please consider making a donation or contributing back to the project any way you can!
6.5.2.detailed_readme:
title: README

General Info

TrueCharts can be installed as both normal Helm Charts or as Apps on TrueNAS SCALE. However only installations using the TrueNAS SCALE Apps system are supported.

For more information about this App, please check the docs on the TrueCharts website

This chart is not maintained by the upstream project and any issues with the chart should be raised here

Support

  • Please check our quick-start guides for TrueNAS SCALE.
  • See the Website
  • Check our Discord
  • Open a issue

Sponsor TrueCharts

TrueCharts can only exist due to the incredible effort of our staff. Please consider making a donation or contributing back to the project any way you can!

All Rights Reserved - The TrueCharts Project

attrs.label: Address Pools
attrs.description: The list of IPAddressPools to advertise via this advertisement, selected by name.

attrs.label: Node Selectors
attrs.description: NodeSelectors allows to limit the nodes to announce as next hops for the LoadBalancer IP. When empty, all the nodes having  are announced as next hops.

questions.label: Communities
questions.description: Community is a collection of aliases for communities. Users can define named aliases to be used in the BGPPeer CRD.

attrs.label: Name
attrs.description: The name of the alias for the community.

attrs.label: Value
attrs.description: The BGP community value corresponding to the given name.

questions.label: Peers
questions.description: BGPPeer is the Schema for the peers API.

attrs.label: Name
attrs.description: The name of the peer.

attrs.label: BFD Profile
attrs.description: The name of the BFD Profile to be used for the BFD session associated to the BGP session. If not set, the BFD session won't be set up.

attrs.label: EBGP MultiHop
attrs.description: TTo set if the BGPPeer is multi-hops away. Needed for FRR mode only.

attrs.label: Hold Time
attrs.description: Requested BGP hold time, per RFC4271.

attrs.label: Keep Alive Time
attrs.description: Requested BGP keep alive time, per RFC4271.

attrs.label: My ASN
attrs.description: AS number to use for the local end of the session.

attrs.label: Password
attrs.description: Authentication password for routers enforcing TCP MD5 authenticated sessions

attrs.label: Peer ASN
attrs.description: AS number to expect from the remote end of the session.

attrs.label: Peer Address
attrs.description: Address to dial when establishing the session.

attrs.label: Peer Port
attrs.description: Port to dial when establishing the session.

attrs.label: Router ID
attrs.description: BGP router ID to advertise to the peer

attrs.label: Source Address
attrs.description: Source address to use when establishing the session.

attrs.label: Node Selectors
attrs.description: Only connect to this peer on nodes that match one of these selectors.

questions.label: BGP Advertisements
questions.description: BGPAdvertisement allows to advertise the IPs coming from the selected IPAddressPools via BGP.

attrs.label: Name
attrs.description: Name of the BGP Advertisement

attrs.label: Address Pools
attrs.description: The list of IPAddressPools to advertise via this advertisement, selected by name.

attrs.label: Aggregation Length
attrs.description: The aggregation-length advertisement option lets you "roll up" the /32s into a larger prefix. Defaults to 32. Works for IPv4 addresses.

attrs.label: Local Pref
attrs.description: The BGP LOCAL_PREF attribute which is used by BGP best path algorithm, Path with higher localpref is preferred over one with lower localpref.

attrs.label: Communities
attrs.description: The BGP communities to be associated with the announcement. Each item can be a community of the form 1234:1234 or the name of an alias defined in the Community CRD.

attrs.label: Peers
attrs.description: Peers limits the BGPpeer to advertise the ips of the selected pools to. When empty, the loadbalancer IP is announced to all the BGPPeers configured.

5.3.0.app_readme:
A network load-balancer implementation for Kubernetes using standard routing protocols

This App is supplied by TrueCharts, for more information visit the manual: https://truecharts.org/charts/enterprise/metallb-config

TrueCharts can only exist due to the incredible effort of our staff. Please consider making a donation or contributing back to the project any way you can!
5.3.0.detailed_readme:
title: README

General Info

TrueCharts can be installed as both normal Helm Charts or as Apps on TrueNAS SCALE. However only installations using the TrueNAS SCALE Apps system are supported.

For more information about this App, please check the docs on the TrueCharts website

This chart is not maintained by the upstream project and any issues with the chart should be raised here

Support

  • Please check our quick-start guides for TrueNAS SCALE.
  • See the Website
  • Check our Discord
  • Open a issue

Sponsor TrueCharts

TrueCharts can only exist due to the incredible effort of our staff. Please consider making a donation or contributing back to the project any way you can!

attrs.description: A list of IP address ranges over which MetalLB has authority. You can list multiple ranges in a single pool, they will all share the same settings. Each range can be either a CIDR prefix, or an explicit start-end range of IPs.
